title: MAG 180 - Moving On Transcript-converted
text:
s? 
MARTIN 
Huh, exactly. 
ARCHIVIST 
A beautiful oasis, untouched by the end of the world. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 180 – Moving On 
20 
MARTIN 
It’s got to be worth a shot, right? 
ARCHIVIST 
Thank you. 
MARTIN 
Don’t fret it. It’s just nice to see you like this. 
[Tape clicks off] 
[Tape clicks on] 
[Bird song, much closer and clearer] 
[The distant sound of music] 
MARTIN 
So what now? I don’t see a doorbell. 
ARCHIVIST 
I’m not even sure this door actually opens. 
MARTIN 
But it should, it’s the front door! Besides, it’s the biggest one so if it’s not— 
ARCHIVIST 
I mean maybe they expect you to come in through the café or, I mean, they 
usually have a little gift shop or something. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 180 – Moving On 
21 
MARTIN 
Okay, so where would they be? 
ARCHIVIST 
No idea. (chuckling) 
MARTIN 
I thought you said you’d been here before. 
ARCHIVIST 
I said I might have been, and even if I have, I was twelve. 
MARTIN 
I’ll tell you what, it is more convenient when you know everything. 
[Sounds of a keys and a large door unlocking] 
ARCHIVIST 
(Pleased) Oh! Guess I was wrong. 
MARTIN 
Get ready. 
ARCHIVIST 
To do what? 
MARTIN 
What do you mean “What”? Smite them. If we need to. 
Wait, hang on, can you even smite people here? 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 180 – Moving On 
22 
ARCHIVIST 
I-I don’t think so. 
[Door opens, piano music can be heard playing] 
MARTIN 
Oh. Oh no… ah... 
[Footstep] 
ANNABELLE 
Good morning. 
MARTIN 
…Uh… Yes. 
ANNABELLE 
Come on in. He’s waiting for you. 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh. And who exactly— 
MARTIN 
J-J-John… John… 
ARCHIVIST 
What? 
MARTIN 
I think… um… Annabelle? Annabelle Cane? 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 180 – Moving On 
23 
ANNABELLE 
Come on. He’s very excited, you know. 
[Keys rattle and footsteps as she moves back into the house] 
MARTIN 
So, do we follow or...? 
ARCHIVIST 
I... I suppose. 
[They follow; the door creaks as they open it further, and there is a 
quick glitching-static sound as they pass the threshold] 
(Mild discomfort noises from Martin and the Archivist) 
[Annabelle closes and locks the door] 
ARCHIVIST 
So… Annabelle, what are you playing at? What are you doing here? 
ANNABELLE 
I really wouldn’t worry about that. I’m just helping out around the place a little 
bit. Making myself at home. You know how it is. 
[Their footsteps echo on wooden floors as they follow her through 
the house; the piano music slowly gets louder] 
MARTIN 
John, I don’t like this. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 180 – Moving On 
24 
ANNABELLE 
You can relax, Mr Blackwood. You’re safe here. 
MARTIN 
I don’t feel it. 
ANNABELLE 
Not something I can help, I’m afraid. 
MARTIN 
Though... oh John, do you feel, huh, do you feel hungry? 
ARCHIVIST 
I, um... Actually, I was going to say I’m feeling... really tired. 
ANNABELLE 
Not surprising. When’s the last time you slept? 
(Martin yawns) 
ARCHIVIST 
I don’t know. I mean weeks ago. Months maybe. 
ANNABELLE 
Well there you go, then. 
Just in here. 
[Annabelle opens the door; the piano music becomes clear and 
close; there is a ticking antique clock sometimes audible] 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 180 – Moving On 
25 
ANNABELLE (CONT’D) 
Your guests are here, Mikaele. 
[Piano playing pauses] 
MIKAELE 
Hoo-hoo-hoo! Excellent! Come in, come in! Ah, a pleasure to meet both of you. 
Thank you Annabelle. 
ANNABELLE 
You’re quite welcome. 
[Piano playing resumes] 
ANNABELLE (CONT’D) 
Have fun. 
ARCHIVIST 
(Extremely tired) Sorry, Mikaele... Salesa? 
MIKAELE 
The one and only. I must say I’ve been, uh... 
[The Archivist and Martin collapse with a small sigh, fast asleep] 
[Piano playing stops] 
(Disappointed umm from Mikaela) 
(Beat)
